note_content.Chief Complaint: Follow-up consultation for ongoing radiation therapy management in prostate cancer.
note_content.History of Present Illness: Patient continues to receive radiation therapy as scheduled. Reports mild fatigue and occasional mild skin irritation but no severe reactions or complications.
note_content.Past Medical History: Diagnosed with localized prostate cancer in early 2023. No other significant medical history.
note_content.Past Surgical History: Prostate biopsy in 2023 confirmed cancer diagnosis, no other surgical history.
note_content.Family History: Father died of prostate cancer at age 67.
note_content.Social History: Michael is retired and lives with his wife. Non-smoker and occasional alcohol use.
note_content.The Review of Systems: Patient denies any unexpected symptoms; reports expected side effects of radiation therapy including fatigue.
note_content.Vital Signs: Blood pressure stable, other vital signs within normal limits.
note_content.Physical Examination: Skin check around radiation site shows minimal erythema, no signs of severe burns or ulcerations.
note_content.Investigations: Latest PSA levels have shown a good response to treatment; levels are decreasing as expected.
note_content.Problem: Ongoing management of localized prostate cancer with radiation therapy.
note_content.Plan: Continue with the current course of radiation therapy. Monitor for any severe reactions or changes in symptoms. Follow up in one month or earlier if symptoms worsen.
